predicate.note: Frames file for 'dominate' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class contiguous_location-47.8, other framed members include 'contain' 'cover' 'fill' 'support' and 'top'. I don't think those are the sense 'dominate' is usually used in, though. Using 'surpass' sense of 'top'.

roleset.name: surpass

example.name: active
example.text: Pioneer Electronic and Sony, both of which *trace* dominated buying earlier this month, continued to fall Wednesday.
example.arg: *trace* -> both of which -> Pioneer Electronic and Sony

example.name: passive
example.text: The board is dominated *trace* by the heirs of the late John T. Dorrance Jr., who controlled about 58% of Campbell's stock when he died in April.
example.arg: the heirs of the late John T. Dorrance Jr., who controlled about 58% of Campbell's stock when he died in April

roleset.note: Could take an arg2 'instrument' ("John dominates any room with his overwhelming B.O.") but we'll wait to see what the corpus says.
